description:
The document that governs the terms of carriage between shipper and carrier for maritime transportation. Two distinct types of transport documents exist:
- Bill of Lading
- Sea Waybill.

transportDocumentReference.description: A unique number allocated by the shipping line to the transport document and the main number used for the tracking of the status of the shipment.

transportDocumentCreatedDateTime.description: Date and time when the TransportDocument was created

transportDocumentUpdatedDateTime.description: Date and time when the TransportDocument was updated

issueDate.description: Date when the transport document has been issued

shippedOnBoardDate.description: Date when the last container that is linked to the transport document is physically loaded onboard the vessel indicated on the transport document.

receivedForShipmentDate.description: Date when the last container linked to the transport document is physically in the terminal (customers cleared against the intended vessel).

numberOfOriginals.description: Number of original copies of the negotiable bill of lading that has been issued to the customer.

issuerCode.description: The code used for identifying the specific issuer.

issuerCodeListProvider.description: The provider used for identifying the issuer Code

declaredValueCurrency.description: The currency used for the declared value, using the 3-character code defined by ISO 4217.

declaredValue.description: The value of the cargo that the shipper declares to avoid the carrier's limitation of liability and "Ad Valorem" freight, i.e. freight which is calculated based on the value of the goods declared by the shipper.

numberOfRiderPages.description: The number of additional pages required to contain the goods description on a transport document. Only applicable for physical transport documents.

allOf.description:
General purpose object to capture location-related data, the location can be specified in **any** of the following ways: `geoLocation` (lat+long), `UN Location Code`, a `Facility` or an `Address`.

If multiple ways are used - then they all have to point to the same location!

latitude.description: Geographic coordinate that specifies the northâ€“south position of a point on the Earth's surface.

longitude.description: Geographic coordinate that specifies the eastâ€“west position of a point on the Earth's surface.

UNLocationCode.description: The UN Location code specifying where the place is located.

facilityCode.description: The code used for identifying the specific facility. This code does not include the UN Location Code.

facilityCodeListProvider.description: The provider used for identifying the facility Code

allOf.description: An object for storing address related information

street.description: The name of the street of the partyâ€™s address.

streetNumber.description: The number of the street of the partyâ€™s address.

floor.description: The floor of the partyâ€™s street number.

postCode.description: The post code of the partyâ€™s address.

city.description: The city name of the partyâ€™s address.

stateRegion.description: The state/region of the partyâ€™s address.

country.description: The country of the partyâ€™s address.

allOf.description: The location where the original transport document (bill of lading) will be or has been issued.
The entire Shipping Instruction object with all nested objects including the confirmed booking(s).
The `shippingInstructionReference` along with the `documentStatus`, created and updated timestamps is returned
The identifier for a shipping instruction provided by the carrier for system purposes.

The status of the Bill of Lading. Possible values are: - RECE (Received) - PENU (Pending Update) - DRFT (Draft) - PENA (Pending Approval) - APPR (Approved) - ISSU (Issued) - SURR (Surrendered) - VOID (Void) More details can be found on GitHub. Be aware that the list linked to is the `ShipmentEventTypeCodes` which is equivalent to `documentStatus`, the list is a subset of the possible values.
Date and time when the ShippingInstruction was created
Date and time when the ShippingInstruction was updated

The Shipping Instruction is an enrichment to the original booking shared by the shipper to the carrier. The shipping instruction includes volume or weight, cargo items, shipping dates, origin, destination, and other special instructions. The information given by the shipper through the shipping instruction is the information required to create a Transport Document.
The part of the ShippingInstruction that contains simple fields (no nested objects)

transportDocumentTypeCode.description:
Specifies the type of the transport document
- BOL (Bill of Lading)
- SWB (Sea Waybill)

isShippedOnboardType.description: Specifies whether the Transport document is a received for shipment, or shipped onboard.

numberOfCopies.description: The requested number of copies of the Transport document to be issued by the carrier. Only applicable for physical documents

numberOfOriginals.description: Number of original copies of the negotiable bill of lading that has been requested by the customer.

isElectronic.description: An indicator whether the transport document is electronically transferred.

isToOrder.description: Indicates whether the transport document is issued `to order` or not

areChargesDisplayedOnOriginals.description: An indicator of whether the charges are displayed on the original documents.

areChargesDisplayedOnCopies.description: An indicator of whether the charges are displayed on the copies of the documents.

allOf.description: The address of the Party to be displayed on the transport document.
The address of the Place of Receipt to be displayed on the transport document.
The address of the Party to be displayed on the transport document.
The address of the Port of Load to be displayed on the transport document.
The address of the Party to be displayed on the transport document.
The address of the Port of Discharge to be displayed on the transport document.
The address of the Party to be displayed on the transport document.
The address of the Place of Delivery to be displayed on the transport document.
A set of unique characters provided by carrier to identify a booking.
The associated booking number provided by the carrier. Cannot be used in combination with Cargo Item level carrierBookingReference
The part of the ShippingInstruction that contains the nested objects.

General purpose object to capture location-related data, the location can be specified in **any** of the following ways: `geoLocation` (lat+long), `UN Location Code`, a `Facility` or an `Address`.

If multiple ways are used - then they all have to point to the same location!

latitude.description: Geographic coordinate that specifies the northâ€“south position of a point on the Earth's surface.

longitude.description: Geographic coordinate that specifies the eastâ€“west position of a point on the Earth's surface.

UNLocationCode.description: The UN Location code specifying where the place is located.

facilityCode.description: The code used for identifying the specific facility. This code does not include the UN Location Code.

facilityCodeListProvider.description: The provider used for identifying the facility Code

allOf.description: An object for storing address related information

street.description: The name of the street of the partyâ€™s address.

streetNumber.description: The number of the street of the partyâ€™s address.

floor.description: The floor of the partyâ€™s street number.

postCode.description: The post code of the partyâ€™s address.

city.description: The city name of the partyâ€™s address.

stateRegion.description: The state/region of the partyâ€™s address.

country.description: The country of the partyâ€™s address.

allOf.description: The location where the original transport document (bill of lading) will be issued.

items.description: Specifies the container assigned to a shipment (`equipment`), all its content (`cargoItems`), the `seals` used and possible `reefer` settings

equipment.description: used for storing cargo in/on during transport. The equipment size/type is defined by the ISO 6346 code. The most common equipment size/type is 20'/40'/45' Dry Freight Container, but several different versions exist.

equipmentReference.description:
The unique identifier for the equipment, which should follow the BIC ISO Container Identification Number where possible.
According to ISO 6346, a container identification code consists of a 4-letter prefix and a 7-digit number (composed of a 3-letter owner code, a category identifier, a serial number, and a check-digit). If a container does not comply with ISO 6346, it is suggested to follow Recommendation #2 â€œContainer with non-ISO identificationâ€� from SMDG.

ISOEquipmentCode.description: Unique code for the different equipment size/type used for transporting commodities. The code is a concatenation of ISO Equipment Size Code and ISO Equipment Type Code A and follows the ISO 6346 standard.

tareWeight.description: The weight of an empty container (gross container weight).

weightUnit.description: The unit of measure which can be expressed in imperial or metric terms

cargoGrossWeightUnit.description: The unit of measure which can be expressed in imperial or metric terms

cargoGrossWeight.description: The grand total weight of the cargo and weight per container(s) including packaging items being carried, which can be expressed in imperial or metric terms, as provided by the shipper. Excludes the tare weight of the container(s).

isShipperOwned.description: Indicates whether the container is shipper owned (SOC).

items.description: addresses the cargo items to be stuffed into a container for a shipment. A cargo item cannot be split across containers.
identifies the specific details of packages within a cargo item.

cargoLineItemID.description: Identifies the cargo line item (package) within the cargo. The cargo line item ID is provided by the shipper and is used to define the stuffing. Cargo line items belonging to the same cargo items are stuffed in the same container.

shippingMarks.description: The identifying details of a package or the actual markings that appear on the package(s). This information is provided by the shipper.

allOf.description: A set of unique characters provided by carrier to identify a booking.
The associated booking number provided by the carrier for this cargo item. Cannot be used in combination with Shipping Instruction header level carrierBookingReference

descriptionOfGoods.description: The cargo description are details which accurately and properly describe the cargo being shipped in the container(s) as provided by the shipper.

HSCode.description: Used by customs to classify the product being shipped.

weight.description: The total weight of the cargo including packaging items being carried in the container(s). Excludes the tare weight of the container(s).

volume.description: Calculated by multiplying the width, height, and length of the packed cargo.

weightUnit.description: The unit of measure which can be expressed in imperial or metric terms

volumeUnit.description: The unit of measure which can be expressed in either imperial or metric terms

numberOfPackages.description: Specifies the number of packages associated with this cargo item

packageCode.description: The unique identifier for the package type

items.description: references provided by the shipper or freight forwarder at the time of booking or at the time of providing shipping instruction. Carriers share it back when providing track and trace event updates, some are also printed on the B/L. Customers can use these references to track shipments in their internal systems.

referenceType.description: The reference type codes defined by DCSA. - FF (Freight Forwarderâ€™s Reference) - SI (Shipperâ€™s Reference) - PO (Purchase Order Reference) - CR (Customerâ€™s Reference) - AAO (Consigneeâ€™s Reference) - ECR (Empty container release reference) - CSI (Customer shipment ID) - BPR (Booking party reference number) - BID (Booking Request ID) More details can be found on GitHub. Be aware that the list is a subset of the possible values.

referenceValue.description: The actual value of the reference.

activeReeferSettings.description: specifies the settings for an active reefer container used to a shipment.

temperatureMin.description: Indicates the minimum temperature setting on the container.

temperatureMax.description: Indicates the maximum temperature setting on the container.

humidityMin.description: Indicates the minimum humidity setting on the container in percent.

humidityMax.description: Indicates the maximum humidity setting on the container in percent.

ventilationMin.description: Indicates the minimum ventilation setting on the container in CBM/Hr.

ventilationMax.description: Indicates the maximum ventilation setting on the container in CBM/Hr.

items.description: addresses the seal-related information associated with the shipment equipment. A seal is put on a shipment equipment once it is loaded. This seal is meant to stay on until the shipment equipment reaches its final destination.

sealNumber.description: Identifies a seal affixed to the container.

sealSource.description:
The source of the seal, namely who has affixed the seal. This attribute links to the Seal Source ID defined in the Seal Source reference data entity.
- CAR (Carrier)
- SHI (Shipper)
- PHY (Phytosanitary)
- VET (Veterinary)
- CUS (Customs)

sealType.description:
The type of seal. This attribute links to the Seal Type ID defined in the Seal Type reference data entity.
- KLP (Keyless padlock)
- BLT (Bolt)
- WIR (Wire)

items.description: stores the parties involved in the transport document.

allOf.description: refers to a company or a legal entity.

taxReference1.description: The identifying number of the consignee or shipper (Individual or entity) used for tax purposes.

taxReference2.description: Optional second identifying number of the consignee or shipper (Individual or entity) used for tax purposes.

publicKey.description: The public key used for a digital signature.

allOf.description: refers to an eBL Party solution provider
Name of the party.
Name of the eBL solution provider

LEI.description: Legal Entity Identifier for the ebl solution provider

publicKey.description: The public key used for a digital signature.

URL.description: A Uniform Resource Locator pointing to the solution provider

allOf.description: An object for storing address related information

street.description: The name of the street of the partyâ€™s address.

streetNumber.description: The number of the street of the partyâ€™s address.

floor.description: The floor of the partyâ€™s street number.

postCode.description: The post code of the partyâ€™s address.

city.description: The city name of the partyâ€™s address.

stateRegion.description: The state/region of the partyâ€™s address.

country.description: The country of the partyâ€™s address.

partyContactDetails.description: A list of contact details - the list cannot be empty

allOf.description: Contact information for a Party

DCSAResponsibleAgencyCode.description:
A DCSA provided code for UN/CEFACT code list providers:
- ISO (International Standards Organization)
- UNECE (United Nations Economic Commission for Europe)
- LLOYD (Lloyd's register of shipping)
- BIC (Bureau International des Containeurs)
- IMO (International Maritime Organization)
- SCAC (Standard Carrier Alpha Code)
- ITIGG (International Transport Implementation Guidelines Group)
- ITU
- SMDG (Shipplanning Message Development Group)
- EXIS
- FMC (Federal Maritime Commission)
- CBSA (Canada Border Services Agency)
- ZZZ (Mutually defined)

partyCode.description: Code to identify the party as provided by the agency

codeListName.description: The name of the list, provided by the responsible agency

partyFunction.description:
Specifies the role of the party in the context of the given Shipping Instruction.
- OS (Original shipper)
- CN (Consignee)
- COW (Invoice payer on behalf of the consignor (shipper))
- COX (Invoice payer on behalf of the consignee)
- MS (Document/message issuer/sender)
- N1 (First Notify Party)
- N2 (Second Notify Party)
- NI (Other Notify Party)
- DDR (Consignor's freight forwarder)
- DDS (Consignee's freight forwarder)
- HE (Carrier booking office (transportation office))
- SCO (Service contract owner - Defined by DCSA)
- BA (Booking Agency)
- CA (Carrier)

items.description: A single address line.

isToBeNotified.description: Used to decide whether the party will be notified of the arrival of the cargo.

items.description: references provided by the shipper or freight forwarder at the time of booking or at the time of providing shipping instruction. Carriers share it back when providing track and trace event updates, some are also printed on the B/L. Customers can use these references to track shipments in their internal systems.

referenceType.description: The reference type codes defined by DCSA. - FF (Freight Forwarderâ€™s Reference) - SI (Shipperâ€™s Reference) - PO (Purchase Order Reference) - CR (Customerâ€™s Reference) - AAO (Consigneeâ€™s Reference) - ECR (Empty container release reference) - CSI (Customer shipment ID) - BPR (Booking party reference number) - BID (Booking Request ID) More details can be found on GitHub. Be aware that the list is a subset of the possible values.

referenceValue.description: The actual value of the reference.

items.description: Shipment

allOf.description: Shipment 'metadata'

carrierBookingReference.description: A set of unique characters provided by carrier to identify a booking.

carrierBookingRequestReference.description: A reference to the booking during the booking request phase

documentStatus.description: The status of the booking. Possible values are: - RECE (Received) - PENU (Pending Update)- CONF (Confirmed) - REJE (Rejected) - CANC (Cancelled) - CMPL (Completed) More details can be found on GitHub. Be aware that the list linked to is the `ShipmentEventTypeCodes` which is equivalent to `documentStatus`, the list is a subset of the possible values.

shipmentCreatedDateTime.description: The date and time when the shipment was created.

shipmentUpdatedDateTime.description: Last date and time when the Shipment was updated.

termsAndConditions.description: Carrier general terms and conditions for the booking.

allOf.description: includes the information requested in a booking, service terms and types as well as the assigned booking reference by the carrier.
Includes the information requested in a booking, service terms and types as well as the assigned booking reference by the carrier.
The `carrierBookingRequestReference` along with the `documentStatus` is returned

carrierBookingRequestReference.description: A reference to the booking during the booking request phase

allOf.description: The status of the booking. Possible values are: - RECE (Received) - PENU (Pending Update) - CONF (Confirmed) - REJE (Rejected) - CANC (Cancelled) - CMPL (Completed) More details can be found on GitHub. Be aware that the list linked to is the `ShipmentEventTypeCodes` which is equivalent to `documentStatus`, the list is a subset of the possible values.

bookingRequestCreatedDateTime.description: The date and time when the booking request was created

bookingRequestUpdatedDateTime.description: Last date and time when the booking request was updated

allOf.description: The shallow structure of the booking

receiptTypeAtOrigin.description: Indicates the type of service offered at Origin. Options are defined in the Receipt/Delivery entity.

deliveryTypeAtDestination.description: Indicates the type of service offered at Destination. Options are defined in the Receipt/Delivery entity.

cargoMovementTypeAtOrigin.description: Refers to the shipment term at the loading of the cargo into the container. Options are defined in the Cargo Movement Type entity.

cargoMovementTypeAtDestination.description: Refers to the shipment term at the unloading of the cargo out of the container. Options are defined in the Cargo Movement Type entity.

serviceContractReference.description: Reference number for agreement between shipper and carrier through which the shipper commits to provide a certain minimum quantity of cargo over a fixed period, and the carrier commits to a certain rate or rate schedule.

paymentTermCode.description:
Indicates whether freight & charges are due for payment before the shipment is effected, practically before the transport document is released to shipper (Prepaid) or before the shipment is finalized meaning cargo released to consignee (Collect)
- PRE (Prepaid)
- COL (Collect)

isPartialLoadAllowed.description: Indication whether the shipper agrees to load part of the shipment in case where not all of the cargo is delivered within cut-off.

isExportDeclarationRequired.description: Information provided by the shipper whether an export declaration is required for this particular shipment/commodity/destination.

exportDeclarationReference.description: A government document permitting designated goods to be shipped out of the country.  Reference number assigned by an issuing authority to an Export License. The export license must be valid at time of departure. Required if Export declaration required is â€˜Trueâ€™.

isImportLicenseRequired.description: Information provided by the shipper whether an import permit or license is required for this particular shipment/commodity/destination.

importLicenseReference.description: A certificate, issued by countries exercising import controls, that permits importation of the articles stated in the license. Reference number assigned by an issuing authority to an Import License. The import license number must be valid at time of arrival. Required if import license required is â€˜Trueâ€™.

submissionDateTime.description: Date and time of submitting the relevant document and attributes

isAMSACIFilingRequired.description: Customs filing for US (AMS) or Canadian (ACI) customs

isDestinationFilingRequired.description: Indicates whether the shipper will perform the AMS/ACI filing directly or not. Mandatory if AMS/ACI filing is required

contractQuotationReference.description: Information provided by the shipper to identify whether pricing for the shipment has been agreed via a contract or a quotation reference. Mandatory if service contract (owner) is not provided.

expectedDepartureDate.description: The date when the shipment is expected to be loaded on board a vessel as provided by the shipper or its agent. If vessel/voyage or expected date of arrival is not provided, this is mandatory

expectedArrivalDateAtPlaceOfDeliveryStar.description: The start date (provided as a range together with `expectedArrivalDateEnd`) for when the shipment is expected to arrive at final destination. If vessel/voyage or expected date of departure is not provided, this is mandatory together with `expectedArrivalDateEnd`

expectedArrivalDateAtPlaceOfDeliveryEnd.description: The end date (provided as a range together with `expectedArrivalDateStart`) for when the shipment is expected to arrive at final destination. If vessel/voyage or expected date of departure is not provided, this is mandatory together with `expectedArrivalDateStart`

transportDocumentTypeCode.description:
Specifies the type of the transport document
- BOL (Bill of Lading)
- SWB (Sea Waybill)

transportDocumentReference.description: A unique number allocated by the shipping line to the transport document and the main number used for the tracking of the status of the shipment.

bookingChannelReference.description: Identification number provided by the platform/channel used for booking request/confirmation, ex: Inttra booking reference, or GTNexus, other. Conditional on booking channel being used

incoTerms.description: Transport obligations, costs and risks as agreed between buyer and seller.

communicationChannelCode.description:
Specifying which communication channel is to be used for this booking e.g.
- EI (EDI transmission)
- EM (Email)
- AO (API)

isEquipmentSubstitutionAllowed.description: Indicates if an alternate equipment type can be provided by the carrier.

vesselName.description: The name of the Vessel given by the Vessel Operator and registered with IMO.

vesselIMONumber.description: The unique reference for a registered Vessel. The reference is the International Maritime Organisation (IMO) number, also sometimes known as the Lloyd's register code, which does not change during the lifetime of the vessel

exportVoyageNumber.description: The vessel operator-specific identifier of the export Voyage.

allOf.description: The mode of transport as defined by DCSA.
The mode of transport performed by the shipper for preCarriage as defined by DCSA.
The deep structure of the booking

anyOf.description: An interfrace used to express a location using an `Address` object

allOf.description: An object for storing address related information

street.description: The name of the street of the partyâ€™s address.

streetNumber.description: The number of the street of the partyâ€™s address.

floor.description: The floor of the partyâ€™s street number.

postCode.description: The post code of the partyâ€™s address.

city.description: The city name of the partyâ€™s address.

stateRegion.description: The state/region of the partyâ€™s address.

country.description: The country of the partyâ€™s address.

anyOf.description: An interfrace used to express a location using a `Un Location Code`

UNLocationCode.description: The UN Location code specifying where the place is located.

anyOf.description: An interfrace used to express a location using a `Facility`. The facility can either be expressed using a `BIC` code or a `SMDG` code

UNLocationCode.description: The UN Location code specifying where the place is located.

facilityCode.description: The code used for identifying the specific facility. This code does not include the UN Location Code.

facilityCodeListProvider.description: The provider used for identifying the facility Code

invoicePayableAt.description: General purpose object to capture location-related data, the location can be specified in **any** of the following ways: `UN Location Code`, a `Facility` or an `Address`.

allOf.description:
General purpose object to capture location-related data, the location can be specified in **any** of the following ways: `geoLocation` (lat+long), `UN Location Code`, a `Facility` or an `Address`.

If multiple ways are used - then they all have to point to the same location!

latitude.description: Geographic coordinate that specifies the northâ€“south position of a point on the Earth's surface.

longitude.description: Geographic coordinate that specifies the eastâ€“west position of a point on the Earth's surface.

UNLocationCode.description: The UN Location code specifying where the place is located.

facilityCode.description: The code used for identifying the specific facility. This code does not include the UN Location Code.

facilityCodeListProvider.description: The provider used for identifying the facility Code

allOf.description: An object for storing address related information

street.description: The name of the street of the partyâ€™s address.

streetNumber.description: The number of the street of the partyâ€™s address.

floor.description: The floor of the partyâ€™s street number.

postCode.description: The post code of the partyâ€™s address.

city.description: The city name of the partyâ€™s address.

stateRegion.description: The state/region of the partyâ€™s address.

country.description: The country of the partyâ€™s address.

allOf.description: The location where the original transport document (bill of lading) will be issued.

items.description: Type of goods in the booking, defined by its commodity type

commodityType.description: High-level description of goods to be shipped which allow the carrier to confirm acceptance and commercial terms. To be replaced by "description of goods" upon submission of shipping instruction

HSCode.description: Used by customs to classify the product being shipped.

cargoGrossWeight.description: The grand total weight of the cargo and weight per container(s) including packaging items being carried, which can be expressed in imperial or metric terms, as provided by the shipper. Excludes the tare weight of the container(s).

cargoGrossWeightUnit.description: The unit of measure which can be expressed in imperial or metric terms

exportLicenseIssueDate.description: Issue date of the export license applicable to the booking. Mandatory to provide in booking request for specific commodities

exportLicenseExpiryDate.description:
Expiry date of the export license applicable to the booking.

Mandatory to provide in booking request for specific commodities.

items.description: Type of goods in the booking, defined by its commodity type

valueAddedServiceCode.description:
Code of the value added service
- SCON (Smart containers)
- CINS (Cargo insurance)
- SIOT (Smart IoT devices)
- CDECL (Customs declaration)
- SGUAR (Shipping guarantee)
- UPPY (Upfront payment)

items.description: references provided by the shipper or freight forwarder at the time of booking or at the time of providing shipping instruction. Carriers share it back when providing track and trace event updates, some are also printed on the B/L. Customers can use these references to track shipments in their internal systems.

referenceType.description: The reference type codes defined by DCSA. - FF (Freight Forwarderâ€™s Reference) - SI (Shipperâ€™s Reference) - PO (Purchase Order Reference) - CR (Customerâ€™s Reference) - AAO (Consigneeâ€™s Reference) - ECR (Empty container release reference) - CSI (Customer shipment ID) - BPR (Booking party reference number) - BID (Booking Request ID) More details can be found on GitHub. Be aware that the list is a subset of the possible values.

referenceValue.description: The actual value of the reference.

items.description: The requested equipments for the booking

requestedEquipmentSizeType.description: Unique code for the different equipment size/type used for transporting commodities. The code is a concatenation of ISO Equipment Size Code and ISO Equipment Type Code A and follows the ISO 6346 standard.

isShipperOwned.description: Indicates whether the container is shipper owned (SOC).

items.description: stores the parties involved in the transport document.

allOf.description: refers to a company or a legal entity.

taxReference1.description: The identifying number of the consignee or shipper (Individual or entity) used for tax purposes.

taxReference2.description: Optional second identifying number of the consignee or shipper (Individual or entity) used for tax purposes.

publicKey.description: The public key used for a digital signature.

DCSAResponsibleAgencyCode.description:
A DCSA provided code for UN/CEFACT code list providers:
- ISO (International Standards Organization)
- UNECE (United Nations Economic Commission for Europe)
- LLOYD (Lloyd's register of shipping)
- BIC (Bureau International des Containeurs)
- IMO (International Maritime Organization)
- SCAC (Standard Carrier Alpha Code)
- ITIGG (International Transport Implementation Guidelines Group)
- ITU
- SMDG (Shipplanning Message Development Group)
- EXIS
- FMC (Federal Maritime Commission)
- CBSA (Canada Border Services Agency)
- ZZZ (Mutually defined)

partyCode.description: Code to identify the party as provided by the agency

codeListName.description: The name of the list, provided by the responsible agency

partyFunction.description:
Specifies the role of the party in the context of the given Shipping Instruction.
- OS (Original shipper)
- CN (Consignee)
- COW (Invoice payer on behalf of the consignor (shipper))
- COX (Invoice payer on behalf of the consignee)
- MS (Document/message issuer/sender)
- N1 (First Notify Party)
- N2 (Second Notify Party)
- NI (Other Notify Party)
- DDR (Consignor's freight forwarder)
- DDS (Consignee's freight forwarder)
- HE (Carrier booking office (transportation office))
- SCO (Service contract owner - Defined by DCSA)
- BA (Booking Agency)
- CA (Carrier)

items.description: A single address line.

isToBeNotified.description: Used to decide whether the party will be notified of the arrival of the cargo.

items.description: maps the relationship between Shipment and Location, e.g., the place of receipt and the places of delivery for a specific shipment.

allOf.title: shipmentLocation
allOf.description: maps the relationship between Shipment and Location, e.g., the place of receipt and the places of delivery for a specific shipment.

General purpose object to capture location-related data, the location can be specified in **any** of the following ways: `geoLocation` (lat+long), `UN Location Code`, a `Facility` or an `Address`.

If multiple ways are used - then they all have to point to the same location!

latitude.description: Geographic coordinate that specifies the northâ€“south position of a point on the Earth's surface.

longitude.description: Geographic coordinate that specifies the eastâ€“west position of a point on the Earth's surface.

UNLocationCode.description: The UN Location code specifying where the place is located.

facilityCode.description: The code used for identifying the specific facility. This code does not include the UN Location Code.

facilityCodeListProvider.description: The provider used for identifying the facility Code

allOf.description: An object for storing address related information

street.description: The name of the street of the partyâ€™s address.

streetNumber.description: The number of the street of the partyâ€™s address.

floor.description: The floor of the partyâ€™s street number.

postCode.description: The post code of the partyâ€™s address.

city.description: The city name of the partyâ€™s address.

stateRegion.description: The state/region of the partyâ€™s address.

country.description: The country of the partyâ€™s address.

displayedName.description: The address of the Party to be displayed on the transport document.

shipmentLocationTypeCode.description:
Links to the Location Type Code defined by DCSA.
- PRE (Place of Receipt)
- POL (Port of Loading)
- POD (Port of Discharge)
- PDE (Place of Delivery)
- PCF (Pre-carriage From)
- PSR (Pre-carriage under shipperâ€™s responsibility)
- OIR (Onward In-land Routing)
- DRL (Depot release location)
- ORI (Origin of goods)
- IEL (Container intermediate export stop off location)
- PTP (Prohibited transshipment port)
- RTP (Requested transshipment port)
- FCD (Full container drop-off location)
- ECP (Empty container pick-up date and time)
- IPA (Invoice payable at)
- FDE (Final destination)

eventDateTime.description: A date when the event is taking place at the location

items.description: A list of transports sorted by ShipmentTransport sequenceNumber

transportPlanStage.description:
Code qualifying a specific stage of transport e.g. pre-carriage, main carriage transport or on-carriage transport
- PRC (Pre-Carriage)
- MNC (Main Carriage Transport)
- ONC (On-Carriage Transport)

transportPlanStageSequenceNumber.description: Sequence number of the transport plan stage

allOf.description:
General purpose object to capture location-related data, the location can be specified in **any** of the following ways: `geoLocation` (lat+long), `UN Location Code`, a `Facility` or an `Address`.

If multiple ways are used - then they all have to point to the same location!

facilityCode.description: The code used for identifying the specific facility. This code does not include the UN Location Code.

modeOfTransport.description: The mode of transport as defined by DCSA.

vesselName.description: The name of the Vessel given by the Vessel Operator and registered with IMO.

vesselIMONumber.description: The unique reference for a registered Vessel. The reference is the International Maritime Organisation (IMO) number, also sometimes known as the Lloyd's register code, which does not change during the lifetime of the vessel

importVoyageNumber.description: The vessel operator-specific identifier of the import Voyage.

exportVoyageNumber.description: The vessel operator-specific identifier of the export Voyage.

isUnderShippersResponsibility.description: Indicator whether mode of transportation for pre-carriage (e.g. truck, barge, rail) is under shipper's responsibility

items.description: Cut off times

cutOffDateTimeCode.description:
Code for the cut-off time
- DCO (Documentation cut-off)
- VCO (VGM cut-off)
- FCO (FCL delivery cut-off)
- LCO (LCL delivery cut-off)
- ECP (Empty container pick-up date and time)
- EFC (Earliest full-container delivery date)
- AFD (AMS Filing Due date)

items.description: maps the relationship between Shipment and Location, e.g., the place of receipt and the places of delivery for a specific shipment.

eventDateTime.description: A date when the event is taking place at the location

items.description: The confirmed equipments for the booking

confirmedEquipmentSizeType.description: Unique code for the different equipment size/type used for transporting commodities. The code is a concatenation of ISO Equipment Size Code and ISO Equipment Type Code A and follows the ISO 6346 standard.

items.description: addresses the monetary value of freight and other service charges for a transport document.

chargeType.description: Free text field describing the charge type to apply

currencyAmount.description: The monetary value of all freight and other service charges for a transport document, with a maximum of 2-digit decimals.

currencyCode.description: The currency for the charge, using a 3-character code (ISO 4217).

paymentTermCode.description:
Indicates whether freight & charges are due for payment before the shipment is effected, practically before the transport document is released to shipper (Prepaid) or before the shipment is finalized meaning cargo released to consignee (Collect)
- PRE (Prepaid)
- COL (Collect)

calculationBasis.description: The code specifying the measure unit used for the corresponding unit price for this cost, such as per day, per ton, per square metre.

unitPrice.description: The unit price of this charge item in the currency of the charge.

quantity.description: The amount of unit for this charge item.

items.description: comprises clauses, added by the carrier to the Transport Document, which are subject to local rules/guidelines or certain mandatory information required to be shared with the customer. Usually printed below the cargo description.

allOf.description: A list of Shipments
